DataElement.preferredName: Lesion Alteration Enhance Tissue Cross Midline Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A classification of the extent that the enhancing tissue of any CET extends into the contralateral hemisphere through white matter commissures (exclusive of herniated ipsilateral tissue).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Lesion Alteration Enhance Tissue Cross Midline
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: (LEE-zhun) An area of abnormal tissue change._A change resulting in something that is different from the original._To improve the quality of something; make better or more attractive._An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function._Travel across or pass over._A medial line, especially the medial line or medial plane of the body (or some part of the body).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: (LEE-zhun) An area of abnormal tissue change.:A change resulting in something that is different from the original.

Concepts.definition: A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part.
The act or process of modifying something.
